He reached the height of his popularity in the thirties, and was all but forgotten after the war.
一生默默无闻
yì shēngmòmòwúwén
remain in obscurity all one\'s life
默默无闻地工作
mòmòwúwén de gōngzuò
work quietly and never show off
蒲松龄号柳泉居士，生前一直默默无闻。
Pú Sōnglíng hào Liǔquánjūshì，shēngqián yìzhí mòmòwúwén。
Pu Songling, little known while alive, was also called Liuquan Jushi.
光荣属于那些默默无闻的幕后工作者。
Guāngróng shǔyú nàxiē mòmòwúwénde mùhòugōngzuòzhě。
The glory should go to those who go unrecognised behind the scenes.
He is one of the many unknowns in the NBA.
NBA里不乏默默无闻的小卒，而他就是其中一个。
The writer became famous while most of his contemporaries were destined to be obscure.
当大多数和他同时代的作家都默默无闻时，他却一举成名。
They used to be in the shade of public life, barely noticed by media.
Tāmen céngjīng zài gōngzhòng shēnghuó lǐ mòmòwúwén，jīhū wèi bèi méitǐ zhùyì guò。
他们曾经在公众生活里默默无闻，几乎未被媒体注意过。
默默无言
mòmòwúyán
without saying a word; silently
一连几天，她总是这么默默的，不理人。
Yì lián jǐ tiān，tā zǒngshì zhème mòmò de，bùlǐ rén。
She\'s been like that for days, silent and unapproachable.
我趴在窗户上，默默观察着城市中疾走的人群。
Wǒ pāzài chuānghu shàng，mòmò guānchá zhe chéngshì zhōng jízǒu de rénqún。
I bent over the window, silently watching the fleet-footed people in the city.
做为他的军眷，她多年来一直默默地支持他的工作。
Zuòwéitā de jūnjuàn，tā duōniánlái yìzhí mòmò de zhīchí tā de gōngzuò。
As the wife of a soldier, she has been silently supporting her husband\'s work for many years.
他站在神龛前默默祈祷。
Tā zhànzài shénkān qián mòmò qídǎo.
He prayed silently in front of the shrine.
如今我们天各一方，只能默默为彼此祝福。
Rújīn wǒmen tiāngè yìfāng，zhǐnéng mòmò wèi bǐcǐ zhùfú。
Now that we are apart, we can only bless each other in our hearts.
默默望着亲人远去的身影，无比惆怅
默默忍受。
They hugged each other in silence for a long time.
他们默默地拥抱了很长时间。
For half a minute, the two men stared upon each other in silence.
Liǎng gè nánzǐ mòmò de níngshìle duìfāng yíhuì。
两个男子默默地凝视了对方一会。
She was crying quietly.
Tā mòmò de kūzhe。
她默默地哭着。
I nodded dumbly and he slit the envelope.
Wǒ mòmò de diǎnlediǎn tóu，érhòu tā biàn sīkāile xìnfēng。
我默默地点了点头，而后他便撕开了信封。
默记在心。
it was none other than Jim Murdoch
不是别人，正是吉姆·默多克
Murdoch owns many newspapers.
Mò duōkè yōngyǒu duō jiā bàozhǐ。
默多克拥有多家报纸。
默读
I have heard people who read badly mumble to themselves.
Wǒ tīngdào nàxiē yuèdú nénglì hěn chà de rén zài xiǎo shēng mòdú。
我听到那些阅读能力很差的人在小声默读。
She was reading to herself and merely subvocalized.
Tā zài mòdú，zhǐ chū yìdiǎndiǎn shēng。
她在默读，只出一点点声。

He has become even more reticent since then.
保持沉默
bǎochí chénmò 
remain silent
他沉默了一会儿又继续说下去。
Tā chénmò le yíhuìr yòu jìxù shuō xiàqù。
After a moment\'s silence he went on.
低头默哀
dītóu mò\'āi
bow one\'s head in silent mourning
他给我递了个眼色，要我保持沉默。
Tā gěi wǒ dì le gè yǎnsè，yào wǒ bǎochí chénmò。
He winked at me to keep silent.
静观默察
jìngguān mò chá
sit back and watch

Huìchǎngshàngyòushì yízhèn jìngmò。
Another spell of silence fell upon the meeting room.
默不作声
mòbúzuòshēng
keep silent

mò\'āi sān fēn zhōng

sùlì mò\'āi

mòqì

严禁
yánjìn
strictly forbid (or prohibit)
学校严禁学生们冒名顶替参加考试。
Xuéxiào yánjìn xuéshengmen màomíng dǐngtì cānjiā kǎoshì。
Sitting for an examination by masquerading under a false name is banned in schools.

严禁赌博。
Yánjìn dǔbó.
Gambling is forbidden.
严查违禁药品，不能让坏人逍遥法外。
Yánchá wéijìn yàopǐn，bùnéng ràng huàirén xiāoyáo fǎwài。

门禁森严
ménjìn sēnyán 
with the entrances heavily guarded
禁不起严峻考验
jīnbuqǐ yánjùn kǎoyàn
fail to stand rigorous tests

我禁不住嘲笑金尼的窘相。
He cleaned his shoes compulsively after every walk.
Měi cì bùxíng zhīhòu tā dōuhuì jìnbúzhù cā gānjìng zìjǐ de xiézǐ。
每次步行之后他都会禁不住擦干净自己的鞋子。
紫禁城由禁卫们把守，外人不得随意进入。
Zǐjìnchéng yóu jìnwèmen bǎshǒu，wàirén bùdé suíyì jìnrù。
The city of Beijing is guarded by imperial guards and strangers are not allowed in.
看他那滑稽的样子，我不禁笑了起来。
Kàn tā nà huájī de yàngzi，wǒ bùjīn xiào le qǐlái。
He looked so funny that I couldn\'t help laughing.
他听到这个不幸的消息，不禁惨然。
Tā tīngdào zhège búxìng de xiāoxi，bújīn cǎnrán。
He couldn\'t but feel deeply grieved at this sad news.
禁止逗留！
Jìnzhǐ dòuliú！
No loitering!
这布禁洗吗？
Zhèbù jīn xǐ ma?
Will this cloth stand a lot of washing?
这鞋禁穿。
Zhè xié jīn chuān。
These shoes are durable.
黑颜色禁脏。
Hēi yánsè jīnzāng。
Black colour doesn\'t show dirt easily.
禁得起艰苦环境的考验
jīn deqǐ jiānkǔ huánjìng de kǎoyàn
be able to stand the test of hardships

Zhèbǎ yǐzi jīn dezhù wǒ zuò ma?

Hé shàng de bīng yǐjing jīn dezhù rén zǒu le。
The ice on the river is thick enough to walk on.
关禁闭
guān jìnbì
be placed in confinement

jìnlièqī
a period when hunting is prohibited

Jìnzhǐ kǎnfá shùmù。

Jìnzhǐ rù nèi。

Jìnzhǐ tíngchē。

Jìnzhǐ tōngxíng。

Jìnzhǐ dào lājī。

禁止招贴。
Jìnzhǐ zhāotiē。

Jìnzhǐ pāizhào。

厉禁
lì jìn

The imprisonment of the union leaders caused a commotion right through the country.

bùjīn shānshan
can\'t keep back one\'s tears

dàxiǎobiàn shījìn

rù guó wèn jìn

失禁
shījìn
lose control over one\'s bladder or rectum functions; be unable to restrain one\'s natural discharges; suffer from incontinence

Tā tuìxiū zhīhòu jiù guò zhe qīngxián de rìzi，bùjīn gǎntàn bìròu fùshēng。

Palaces within the Forbidden City are grand and resplendent.
看到他获得了这个奖项，我不禁妒火中烧。
Kàn dào tā huòdé le zhège jiǎng xiàng，wǒ bùjīn dùhuǒ zhōng shāo。
He got the award, which made me really envious.

It was so hot that people couldn\'t help sweating heavily.

The pirated discs were banned to the great satisfaction of the people.
这些淫秽读物危害青少年身心健康，必须禁绝！

国家法律规定，禁药不能随便买卖。

The laws say that banned medicine is not allowed to be traded.
这种药因有副作用而被禁用。

听说皇上驾到，牢头禁子们都惊慌不已。

bǎohù bīnlínjuézhǒng de yěshēngdòngwù

a broad expanse of fertile flatland
大雪掩盖着田野。
Dàxuě yǎngài zhe tiányě。
The fields were covered with snow.
野狗
yěɡǒu
homeless dogs
说话太野
shuōhuà tài yě
use coarse language; speak rudely
动作太野
dòngzuò tài yě

yěchuánqiú

yěmán xíngwéi

yěxìngnánxùn

Zhèlǐ yǐwǎngshì yípiàn huāngyě。
This place used to be a vast expanse of wasteland.

cūnyě
villages; countryside
野蛮
yěmán

视野
shìyě
field of vision (or view)

wénmíng(yěmán) zhuāngxiè
careful (careless) loading and unloading

The region south of the Yangtze River covers a large area with abundant fields where the people are settled in their respective occupations.
茶枯可以用来杀死池塘里的野杂鱼类。

丛密的森林里常有野兽出没。
Cóngmì de sēnlín lǐ chángyǒu yěshòu chūmò。
There are always wild animals living in thick forests.
树上长满了滴溜儿圆的野果子。
Shù shàng zhǎngmǎn le dīliūryuán de yěguǒzi。
Round wild fruits are growing on the trees.
这里地势高旷，视野辽阔。
Zhèlǐ dìshì gāokuàng，shìyě liáokuò。
The terrain is tall and wide here, you can have a vast field of vision.

她从山里回来时，带回了一栲栳野蘑菇。

这种陷阱可以猎捕到小型的野兽。

耳闻
ěrwén
hear of (or about)

充耳不闻
to turn a deaf ear to sth
对某事充耳不闻

她笑了，假装用她的小手来打我耳光。
If I thought you were serious,I would give you a thick ear!
Rúguǒ wǒ zhīdào nǐ shì rènzhēn de，wǒ huì gěi nǐ yí jì ěrguāng！
如果我知道你是认真的，我会给你一记耳光！
It\'s probably just an excuse to give you a  thick ear anyway.
Bùguǎnzěnyàng，zhè yěxǔ zhǐshì gè wèi dǎ nǐ ěrguāng suǒ xúnzhǎo de yígè lǐyóu。
不管怎样，这也许只是个为打你耳光所寻找的一个理由。
The impatient teacher slapped the student.
Shīqù nàixīn de lǎoshī shānle zhège xuésheng jǐ ěrguāng。
失去耐心的老师扇了这个学生几耳光。
I gave him a good box on the ear.
Wǒ hěnhěn gěile tā yì ěrguāng。
我狠狠给了他一耳光。
He gave me a clip on the ear.
Tā gěile wǒ yì ěrguāng。
他给了我一耳光。
I\'ll box your ears!
Kàn wǒ dǎ nǐ ěrguāng!
看我打你耳光！
当作耳边风
dàngzuò ěrbiānfēng
let sth. go in one ear and out the other; turn a deaf ear to sth.
别把我的劝告当作耳边风。
Bié bǎ wǒ de quàngào dàngzuò ěrbiānfēng。
Don\'t neglect my advice.
她把妈妈的建议当作耳边风。
Tā bǎ māmāde jiànyì dàngzuò ěrbiānfēng。
She turned a deaf ear to her mother\'s advice.
耳朵有点背
ěrduǒ yǒu diǎn bèi
be a bit hard of hearing
侧耳而听
cè\'ěr ér tīng
listen attentively; be all ears
她在她妈妈耳边喳喳了两句。
Tā zài tā māma ěrbiān zhāzha le liǎngjù。
She whispered a few words in her mother\'s ear.
这声音太刺耳。
Zhè shēngyīn tài cì\'ěr。
The sound is too piercing.
刺耳的话
cì\'ěr de huà 
harsh words; sarcastic remarks
左耳失聪
zuǒ\'ěr shīcōng 
become deaf in the left ear
鼎耳
dǐng\'ěr
the ears of a tripod
距此不过五里耳。
Jù cǐ búguò wǔ lǐ\'ěr。
It is only five li from here.
想当然耳。
Xiǎngdāngrán\'ěr。
It is mere conjecture.
老太太有点儿耳背，你说话大声点儿。
Lǎo tàitai yǒudiǎnr ěrbèi，nǐ shuōhuà dà shēng diǎnr。
The old lady is a bit hard of hearing. Louder, please.
耳朵尖
ěrduojiān
have sharp ears
穿耳朵
chuān ěrduo
have one\'s earlobes pierced (for wearing earrings)
大饱耳福
dà bǎo ěrfú

我耳鸣。
Wǒ ěrmínɡ。
My ears are ringing.
挖耳屎
wā ěrshǐ
pick one\'s ears
我知道这是他拉拢我，好让我俯首帖耳地为他效劳。
Wǒ zhīdào zhè shì tā lālǒng wǒ，hǎo ràng wǒ fǔshǒutiē\'ěr de wèi tā xiàoláo
I knew he was trying to wheedle me into being at his beck and call.
附在耳边低声说话
fù zài ěrbiān dīshēng shuōhuà

Tāmen liǎ fù\'ěr tán le jǐ jù。
They whispered a few words to each other.
两个(or 只)耳朵
liǎng gè （or zhī）ěrduǒ
two ears
蝉声聒耳。
Chán shēnɡ ɡuō\'ěr。
The shrilling of the cicadas grated on my ears.
她美妙的歌声依然回荡在我的耳际。
Tā měimiào de gēshēngyīrán huídàngzài wǒ de ěrjì。
Her beautiful songs still ring in my ears.
我简直不能相信自己的耳朵。
Wǒ jiǎnzhí bùnéng xiāngxìn zìjǐ de ěrduo。
I could hardly believe my ears.
钢琴声铿锵悦耳。
Gāngqínshēngkēngqiāngyuè\'ěr。
The piano produced a sonorous and pleasant melody.
良药苦口利于病，忠言逆耳利于行。
Liángyào kǔkǒu lìyú bìng，zhōng yán nì\'ěr lìyú xíng。
Just as bitter medicine cures sickness, unpalatable advice benefits conduct.
他耳朵很灵。
Tā ěrduǒ hěn línɡ。 
He has sharp ears. or His hearing is very good.
他耳朵聋。
Tā ěrduo lónɡ。
He is deaf.

zhēng de miànhóngěrchì

xiū de miànhóngěrchì

ěr bù lónɡ yǎn bù huā

yuè\'ěr de yīnyuè

支棱着耳朵听

Tā zhège rén zuǐjiān，shuō de huà zhēn cì\'ěr。

guō\'ěr
grate on one\'s ears
耳屎
ěrshǐ

悦耳
yuè\'ěr
pleasing to the ear; sweet-sounding

Tā zhè rén zuòfēng bùhǎo，fùmiàn xiāoxi bùjuéyúěr。
He is famous for his loose behavior, and there is negative news about him from time to time.
他制作的这个串铃声音清脆悦耳。
Tā zhìzuò de zhège chuànlíng shēngyīn qīngcuì yuèěr。
This string of bells he made sounds very clear and melodious.
他对师傅一直是垂首帖耳的。
Tā duì shīfu yìzhí shì chuíshǒu tiēěr de。
He was always obedient to his teacher.
隔壁好像有些什么声音，他侧耳谛听。
Gébì hǎo xiàng yǒuxiē shénme shēngyīn，tā cèěr dìtīng。
He listened carefully to the sounds from next door.
消息这么快就传到他那里，莫非有耳报神？
Xiāoxi zhème kuài jiù chuán dào tā nàlǐ，mòfēi yǒu ěrbàoshén?
The news reaches him so quickly, is it possible he has a spy here?
他觉得耳朵眼儿里边疼，医生说是发炎了。
Tā jué de ěrduoyǎnr lǐbian téng，yīshēng shuō shì fāyán le。
He had some itching in his external auditory canal and was informed by the doctor that it was inflamed.
她想穿耳朵眼儿，但是又怕疼，一直犹豫着。
Tā xiǎng chuān ěrduoyǎnr，dànshì yòu pà téng，yìzhí yóuyù zhe。
She is thinking of piercing her ears, but the anticipated pain is making her hesitate.
爆炸的声音震得他耳根发麻。
Bàozhà de shēngyīn zhèn de tā ěrgēn fāmá。
The noise of the explosion made his ears numb.
那天我去听了音乐会，动听的旋律至今回响在耳际。
Nàtiān wǒ qù tīng le yīnlèhuì，dòngtīng de xuánlǜ zhìjīn huíxiǎng zài ěrjì。
On that day I went to the concert , and the beautiful melody  lingers on even today.
小狗豆豆耳尖，老远就听见了主人的脚步声。
Xiǎogǒu dòudòu ěrjiān，lǎoyuǎn jiù tīngjiàn le zhǔrén de jiǎobùshēng。
The dog Doudou is sharp of hearing; it is able to hear the footsteps of its master from far away.
爷爷常说自己年纪大了，耳聋眼花。
Yéye chángshuō zìjǐ niánjì dà le，ěrlóng yǎnhuā。
Grandpa told us that he was old and had become hard of hearing and poor in vision.
成功的喜悦和兴奋使他耳热心跳。
Chénggōng de xǐyuè hé xīngfèn shǐ tā ěrrè xīntiào。
His heart throbbed with excitement and his ears were burning with happiness after he succeeded.
她喜欢购买和收藏漂亮的耳饰。
Tā xǐhuan gòumǎi hé shōucáng piàoliang de ěrshì。
She is fond of buying and collecting beautiful ear ornaments.
老先生虽然上了些年纪，但耳音依然很好。
Lǎo xiānshēng suīrán shàng le xiē niánjì，dàn ěryīn yīrán hěn hǎo。
Though advanced in years, he still has good hearing.
医生建议她使用耳针疗法。
Yīshēng jiànyì tā shǐyòng ěrzhēn liáofǎ.
The doctor suggested she should receive acupuncture treatment.
她一直很珍爱这对儿金耳坠。
Tā yìzhí hěn zhēn\'ài zhè duìr jīn ěrzhuì。
She has always cherished this pair of gold earrings.
这位医生妙手回春，不少耳聋的人经治疗复聪了。
Zhèwèi yīshēng miàoshǒuhuíchūn，bùshǎo ěrlóng de rén jīng zhìliáo fùcōng le。
The doctor is highly competent, many patients recover their lost hearing after receiving treatment.
眼、耳、鼻、舌都是人体的感觉器官。
Yǎn、ěr、bí、shé dōushì réntǐ de gǎnjué qìguān。
The eyes, ears, nose and tongue are sensory organs.
他虽年纪高迈，但仍耳不聋，眼不花。
Tā suī niánjì gāomài，dàn réng ěr bùlóng，yǎn bùhuā。
He is advanced in years, but he has good hearing and eyesight.
请您对这个剧本谈点看法吧，我们洗耳恭听。
Qǐng nín duì zhège jùběn tán diǎn kànfǎ ba，wǒmen xǐěrgōngtīng。
Would you please give your comments on this play. We are waiting to hear them with respect.
耳听得鼓角齐名，想必我们的军队已经开始进攻了。
Ĕrtīng de gǔjiǎo qímíng，xiǎngbì wǒmen de jūnduì yǐjing kāishǐ jìngōng le。
Having heard the battle drums and horns, it is certain that our troops have started their attack.
不知她男朋友在她耳边说了什么，逗得她抿嘴笑了。
Bùzhī tā nánpéngyou zài tā ěrbiān shuō le shénme，dòu de tā mǐnzuǐ xiào le。
Her boyfriend whispered something in her ear that made her compress her lips into a smile.
竖笛的声音轻悠悠地飘进我们的耳朵里。
Shùdí de shēngyīn qīngyōuyōu de piāojìn wǒmen de ěrduǒ lǐ。
The sound of a clarinet floated gently into our ears.
他演奏的音乐可谓绕梁三日，不绝于耳。

布兰妮鲜甜悦耳的歌声让歌迷们为她疯狂。
Bùlánnī xiāntián yuè\'ěr de gēshēng ràng gēmímen wèi tā fēngkuáng。
Britney Spears makes her fans crazy for her with her sweet songs.
文人汇聚，雅言不绝于耳，我真是三生有幸。

I am so happy to participate in refined conversations between men of letters.

他在电影院里感觉音响有点震耳。

Súhuà shuō de hǎo，zhōng yán nìěr lìyú xíng。

他的耳前庭这几天总是疼，想放假以后去医院看看。

Printers once kept the type for capitals and for small letters in separate cases; capitals were kept in the upper half of the type case and so became known as upper-case letters.
Páibǎn gōngrén yídù jiāng dàxiě zìmǔ hé xiǎoxiě zìmǔ huózì zhìyú bùtóng de gépán（case）zhōng；dàxiě zìmó fàngzài gé pán shàng de shàng bànfāng，gù éryòu chēngwéi“upper-case letter”。
排版工人一度将大写字母和小写字母活字置于不同的格盘（case）中；大写字模放在格盘上的上半方，故而又称为“upper-case letter”。

dǎ xiǎosuànpan

run wildly; run like mad
为了全家的生计，父亲整日奔劳。
Wèile quánjiā de shēngjì，fùqīn zhěngrì bēnláo。
In order to support the family, Father bustles about every day.
时光奔逝，他的脸上已经有了深深的皱纹。
Shíguāng bēnshì，tā de liǎnshàng yǐjing yǒu le shēnshēn de zhòuwén。
Time flies, his face is marked with deep wrinkles.
宁静的村庄，奔淌的小溪，就是他对故乡全部的记忆。
Níngjìng de cūnzhuāng，bēntǎng de xiǎoxī，jiùshì tā duì gùxiāng quánbù de jìyì。
The tranquil villages and flowing brooks—that’s all that he can recall about his hometown.
夜深人静，他任由思想奔涌。
Yèshēn rénjìng，tā rènyóu sīxiǎng bēnyǒng。
In the still of night, he allows his mind to run wild.
辽阔的草原上，成群的牛羊在四下奔逐。
Liáokuò de cǎoyuán shàng，chéngqún de niúyáng zài sìxià bēnzhú。
On the wide plain, herds of cattle are frolicking about in the fields.
小狗在草坪里蹿奔玩耍。
Xiǎogǒu zài cǎopíng lǐ cuānbēn wánshuǎ。
The little dog is leaping and running in the grass.
天空乌云翻搅奔腾，眼看着就要下雨了。
Tiānkōng wūyún fānjiǎo bēnténg，yǎn kàn zhe jiùyào xiàyǔ le。
With dark clouds whirling in the sky, it looks like it\'s going to rain.
他义无返顾地离开家乡奔赴未知的前程。
Tā yìwúfǎngù de líkāi jiāxiāng bēnfù wèizhī de qiánchéng。
He left his hometown without turning back in pursuit of his unknown future.
装甲兵开着坦克，在沙漠上奔驰。
Zhuāngjiǎbīng kāi zhe tǎnkè，zài shāmò shàng bēnchí。
The armoured troops are driving a tank and speeding through the desert.
汽车在高速公路上奔驰。
Qìchē zài gāosùgōnglùshàng bēnchí。
The car is speeding along the motorway.
我是奔40的人了。
Wǒ shì bèn sìshíde rén le。
I\'m getting on for forty.

为什么鱼缸里的水那么浑浊啊？
There was a tiny splash as the fish broke the surface.
Yúr zuān chū shuǐmiàn shí，jiàn qǐ le xiǎo shuǐhuā。
鱼儿钻出水面时，溅起了小水花。
Water is the element of fishes.
Shuǐ shì yú de bìyào shēngmìng tiáojiàn。
水是鱼的必要生命条件。
Often when you hook a fish in these shallow rivers they will roll on the surface.
Dāng nǐ zài qiǎnshuǐ hé zhōng gōuzhù yú shí tāmen wǎngwǎng biàn huì tiàochū shuǐmiàn。
当你在浅水河中钩住鱼时他们往往便会跳出水面。
The fish nipped the wader\'s toe.
鱼咬住了涉水者的脚趾。
The fins of a fish act as hydrofoils.
Yú de qí jiùxiàng shuǐ yì chuántǐng de shuǐ yì。
鱼的鳍就像水翼船艇的水翼。
The fish was dropped back into the water.
Yú bèi fànghuí dào le shuǐ lǐ。
鱼被放回到了水里。
It\'s difficult to remove the hook from the fish in the cold water.
Zài lěngshuǐ zhōng hěn nán jiāng yúgōu cóng yú zuǐba lǐ qǔchū。
在冷水中很难将鱼钩从鱼嘴巴里取出。
Fish require an aqueous medium.
Yú de shēnghuó líbùkāi shuǐ。
鱼的生活离不开水。
The fish food will gradually sink to the bottom of the tank.
Yúshí huì mànmàn de chéndào shuǐxiāng de dǐbù。
鱼食会慢慢地沉到水箱的底部。
I ate some fruit followed by a tuna sandwich.
我吃完水果又吃了个金枪鱼三明治。
The hull\'s iron plates deep below the waterline were hit by torpedos.
吃水线下的船身铁板被鱼雷击穿。
Fishing a bait in front of a submerged tree or bush often produces a good fish.
Bǎ yòu\'ěr fàngzài shuǐzhōng de shùmù huò shùcóng qiánmiàn shí jīngcháng huì diào dào dàyú。
把诱饵放在水中的树木或树丛前面时经常会钓到大鱼。
大副发现船的左前方有鲸鱼群。
Dàfù fāxiàn chuán de zuǒqiánfāngyǒu jīngyú qún。
The first mate sighted a herd of whales ahead to the left of the boat.
They are seemingly helpless creatures, apparently easy prey for fish.
Tāmen kàn shàngqù shì ruòxiǎo de shēngwù，xiǎnrán hěn róngyì bèi yúqún bǔhuò。
他们看上去是弱小的生物，显然很容易被鱼群捕获。
The fish were swimming in the ocean.
Yúqún zài hǎiyáng lǐ yóuyǒng。
鱼群在海洋里游泳。
A cluster of schooling fish was swimming away.
一大群鱼成群结队地游走了。
Schooling in fish decreases the chance of being eaten.
Yú\'er chéngqún de huódòng jiàngdīle tāmen bèi chīdiào de jīlǜ。
鱼儿成群的活动降低了它们被吃掉的几率。
Several sharks began a feeding frenzy when large schools of fish swam near.
Dàngchéng qún de yú\'er yóu jìn shí，yìxiē shāyú kāishǐ biǎoxiànchū bǔshí qián de kuángzào。
当成群的鱼儿游近时，一些鲨鱼开始表现出捕食前的狂躁。
Tonight the haddock were shoaling massively in three hundred fathoms.
Jīnwǎn xuěyú jiāngyào dàliàng qúnjí zài jù àn sānbǎi xún de dìfang。
今晚鳕鱼将要大量群集在距岸三百浔的地方。
Clouds of flies were crawling over the dead fish.
Yì qún cāngying zài sǐyú shēnshàng páláipáqù。
一群苍蝇在死鱼身上爬来爬去。
片鱼片儿
piàn yúpiànr
flake a fish
妈妈最拿手的一道菜就是炒鱼片儿。
Māma zuì náshǒu de yídào cài jiùshì chǎoyúpiànr。
The dish that mother makes best is stir-fried sliced fish meat.
生鱼片
shēngyúpiàn
slices of raw fish
溜鱼片儿。
烤鱼片儿。
这片洼地可以改造成鱼塘。
I tried both sushi and sashimi but I prefer sushi.
寿司和生鱼片我都吃了，但是我更喜欢吃寿司。
He cannot stomach raw fish.
Wǒ shízai shòubùliǎo chī shēngyúpiàn。
我实在受不了吃生鱼片。
His dislike for raw fish only deepened in Japan.
Dàole Rìběn hòu，tā duì shēngyúpiàn de yànwù gǎnjué gèngjiā qiángliè le。
到了日本后，他对生鱼片的厌恶感觉更加强烈了。
The scales of some fish possess the strange property of glowing in the dark.
某些鱼的鳞片具有在黑暗中发光的奇特性能。
The chef flaked the fish and carefully stirred it into the sauce.
Chúshī bǎ yú qiēchéng báopiàn，ránhòu xiǎoxīnyìyì de bǎ tā fàngdào jiàngzhī zhōng jiǎo。
厨师把鱼切成薄片，然后小心翼翼地把它放到酱汁中搅。
I\'ll take three salmon steaks.
Wǒ yào sān fèn guīyú pái。
我要三份鲑鱼排。
